ygData.subject: Re: PLing
ygData.msgSnippet: I find that if you approach PL ers nicely they may be willing to hrough a few descent buffs your way. And it gives you a chance to level much quicker.
ygData.messageBody:
I find that if you approach PL'ers nicely they may be willing to
hrough a few descent buffs your way. And it gives you a chance to
level much quicker. Typically people beng PL'd already have high
level characters and are simply getting help in order to supplement
their guild with a different race so they can go on more afective
raids.

I created a Ranger and spent the last 2 years getting him to 35. Then
I created a dwarf rogue and PL'd him to 35 so that I could join a
guild that frowned on Rangers, once I was in the Ranger tagged along.
Soon after that I got another account and created a druid which was
played by myself and friends of mine, essentially PL'ing it to mid
40's so that I could run my Ranger and Rogue around with gates (my
son has several characters on both accounts that he uses as well,
none PL'd).

As for the integrity aspect of it, thats a matter of opinion. Since
when I am PL'ing I am more interested in the level over the goods,
noob's benefit since I give away 90% of what I get. My guild
benefits, since we have a more diverse membership (who wants a guild
full of bloody druids anyway?). However I don't believe that high
level characters should be allowed to camp out a noob location to
benefit just their friends. They should show alot more nobility and
class by assisting any others that may be fighting in the area.

Just my 2 cents worth

Dagdason

--- In EverQuest@y..., "Richard Ong" <nakor@p...> wrote:
> Mmm... it's true that the peopel who are getting PLed are not doing
> much work. They level faster than people who actually level
> themselves. I understand how you would think this is not really
fair
> but sometimes people like to help others. When I help people, I PL
> them. I won't help them get equipment because that's what you need
> to do for yourself since it generally makes you more powerful
> especially magical items. AND when I PL them, I don't take over
> camps to help them level. I just look around for roaming mobs that
> are not a RARE of course and let them kill it. Heal them when
> necessary. The usual method. I don't steal camps from people or
> camp things when tyring to PL 'em. I know that's wrong cuz if I
did
> that I would feel like I'm hogging the camp since I wouldn't get xp
> in the first place and it's a camp that everyone wants to have.
For
> example, PLing in cb. I just look for any orcs i see and let them
> kill it. There are hardly any camps in there. The only camps
there
> are in cb are in the castle itself and near the tents. Anyway, my
> point is, is that I find it wrong when people take over camps to PL
> but I find it ok when people just kill roaming mobs to PL. AND
yeah,
> I don't like when peopel twink. That's why I don't give peopel
> equipment or money. Maybe leather armor but that's about it.
>
> --- In EverQuest@y..., "Dan" <danspth@y...> wrote:
> > Opinions vary. I personally find the whole power leveling idea to
> be most
> > dishonorable. To see an orc camp taken over by a 50+ druid and a
lv
> 6 ogre
> > warrior in full crafted with a wurmslayer reminds me how people
are
> have no
> > willingness to work for things (the whole cheat code thing). But
> many people
> > find it ok to twink/power level and, well, so be it. I can see
it,
> shiver,
> > and keep moving. Live and let live. I am fortunate that at lv 43
I
> can solo
> > and this is only an inconvience at worse to me instead of a real
> issue. But
> > up until lv 35 I was still having camps stolen from me by uber
> twinks and
> > anon druids.
